jobs.title: Backend Software Engineer
jobs.description:
We are TravelPerk: a fast-growing, well-funded startup that [has raised nearly $134m](https://techcrunch.com/2019/07/18/on-a-growth-tear-work-trip-saas-travelperk-adds-60m-to-its-series-c/) since our creation in early 2015. Backed by world-class investors in some of tech’s most disruptive companies, including Slack, Trello, Twitter, Farfetch, Deliveroo and Delivery Hero, our team is made up of A-players from the travel industry.

We’ve been named [the fastest-growing SaaS startup in the world](https://www.saasmag.com/saas-1000-2019/) by the SaaS1000 and featured as one of the hottest startups to watch by both Forbes and Wired. We’re revolutionizing the B2B corporate travel market, worth over $1.3 trillion, by simplifying the process for everyone involved.

Are you a Software Engineer with extensive programming experience? Is your code fast, efficient and reliable? Do you particularly enjoy working with amazing people, having fun at work and building something awesome? If so, let’s talk!

We’re not looking for stack experts. We’re looking for smart people who can bring in the best tools and processes to get the job done. Read more [about our engineering team in this blog post](https://thoughts.travelperk.com/engineering-and-hypergrowth-scaling-travelperk-without-losing-our-culture-f14c464548ef) by our Senior Director of Engineering, Ivan Peralta.

You will work on a day-to-day basis with our product team to design, architect and implement our product. TravelPerk is a next-generation platform to take the pain out of booking and managing business travel. 

**As Backend Software Engineer, this position involves:**

- Product development in  **Python/Django and Tornado**  of the travel-related product.
- **Integrations**  between our product to 3rd party APIs.
- System  **architecture**  design, implementation, and testing.
- Work in an  **Agile environment**  with strong attention to a well-documented code, unit testing, and continuous integration.
- Being able to  **mentor, coach, and train other colleagues**  as a domain expert.

**Required skills and experience:**

- "Product Engineering" mindset.
- Pragmatism and obsession for simplicity, efficiency, and performance.
- Extensive experience in similar roles building technically complex products  **in any web programming language**. Successful candidates usually have 5 years of experience or more.
- An expert level at  **server-side** ,  **client-side**  or  **full stack development**. Your final role within the team will depend on your skills and internal training will be provided.
- Obsession for  **quality**  and  **testing**.
- Eager to  **learn new technologies**  and frameworks.
- Strong  **communication skills**  (in English).

**Bonus points for:**

- Experience in the travel industry.
- DevOps experience with the AWS suite.
- Frontend experience with React
- Experience working with high-performing, Agile development teams.
- People who like to build stuff (we really like people who maintain/contribute to open source projects).

**What do we offer?**

- Competitive compensation including equity in the company.
- 24 vacation days per year and flexible working hours.
- Health perks: Choose between a private health scheme or a gym allowance.
- "Flexible compensation plan" to help you diversify and increase the net salary.
- Free Spanish classes.
- Yoga
- Free coffee and beverages, fresh fruit and other breakfast stuff.

This position requires full-time, in-house work in Barcelona, Spain. We can help with relocation from anywhere in the world. English is the official language at the office. No prior knowledge of Spanish is required.

**TravelPerk is an equal opportunity employer:**  All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, gender, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, national origin, genetics, disability, or age

Backed by world-class investors from some of tech’s most disruptive companies, including Slack, Trello, Twitter, Farfetch, Deliveroo and Delivery Hero, our team is made up of A-players from the online travel industry -  Booking.com and Skyscanner, among others.

Our mission is to revolutionize the B2B corporate travel market, worth over $1.3 trillion, by simplifying the process for everyone involved. In doing so, we’ve been named [the fastest growing SaaS startup in Europe (#5 in the world)](https://saas1000.com/) by SaaS1000 and have been featured as one of the hottest startups to watch by both [Forbes](https://www.forbes.com/sites/davidprosser/2017/09/06/seven-travel-tech-start-ups-taking-europe-by-storm/#1950fc517761) and [Wired](http://www.wired.co.uk/article/best-startups-in-barcelona-2017).

If you’re ready to take off with us, keep reading!

We are looking for a DevOps Engineer that will contribute to the design, development and maintenance of our production and development infrastructure including all our deployment pipelines. As part of your role it will be crucial to ensure that the company has the required tooling to monitor, maintain and control the usage of the production infrastructure and to ensure the security and safety of our applications and data.Read more [about our engineering team in this blog post](https://thoughts.travelperk.com/engineering-and-hypergrowth-scaling-travelperk-without-losing-our-culture-f14c464548ef) by our Senior Director of Engineering, Ivan Peralta.

In this role, you should have a keen eye for detail and excellent automation skills. If you are also competent in monitoring and are passionate about quality, we’d like to meet you.

**Responsibilities:**

- Manage the current Amazon web services infrastructure
- Manage the current code deployment pipelines
- Ensure the safety and security of all our infrastructure and data
- Own the platform budget and make sure that it is used in the most optimal way
- Monitor and maintain all the production machines and services
- Maintain all the cloud tools used on the production infrastructure
- Support product squads with the relevant knowledge about the infrastructure evolution and needs
- Recommend ways to improve the current setup

**Competencies & Requirements:**

- University degree in Computer Science, Engineering or similar
- 3+ years of relevant experience as a DevOps Engineer or similar role working with large-scale infrastructure systems
- Relevant knowledge related to cloud virtualization platforms such as AWS, Azure or Google Cloud
- Relevant knowledge with regards to containerization technologies such as Docker or Kubernetes
- Excellent communication skills, both written and spoken, in English
- Excellent scripting and automation skills

**Knowledge/Understanding of:**

- Scripting (Python, Ansible, Bash, Linux, etc.)
- AWS, Azure, Google Cloud
- Docker
- Codeship, Fastlane, BitRise or similar technologies.

**What do we offer?**

- Competitive compensation including equity in the company.
- 24 vacation days per year and flexible working hours.
- Health perks: Choose between a private health scheme or a gym allowance.
- "Flexible compensation plan" to help you diversify and increase the net salary.
- Free Spanish classes.
- Yoga and meditation.
- Free coffee and beverages, fresh fruit and other breakfast stuff.

This position requires full-time, in-house work in Barcelona, Spain. We can help with relocation from anywhere in the world. English is the official language at the office. No prior knowledge of Spanish is required.

We’ve been named [the fastest-growing SaaS startup in the world](https://www.saasmag.com/saas-1000-2019/) by the SaaS1000 and featured as one of the hottest startups to watch by both Forbes and Wired. We’re revolutionizing the B2B corporate travel market, worth over $1.3 trillion, by simplifying the process for everyone involved.

If you’re ready to take off with us, keep reading!

## What you will do:

We are looking for a Director of Product to scale TravelPerks product and design team into a world class operation. This involves partnering across many functions to deconstruct and simplify challenges to execute our goals. We operate highly autonomous squads that own big problem areas, they will need your strategic support and the tool kit to build a game changing product. As part of the leadership team you will build strong relationships across the business, you will nurture and coach our talented team while also growing the product function. 

Are you looking for a challenge where you can make an impact? Are you passionate about people and product? If you are a humble leader with a track record working on exceptional products we want to speak to you!

As a Director of Product, you will:

- Partner with our inventory (supplier relations team), engineering and the executive team to build and execute robust end to end product strategies. 
- Lead and mentor a team of Product Managers.
- Define, review and monitor OKRs across multiple squads.
- Critically analyse and collect key metrics, leveraging them to validate and weigh your proposals and decisions.
- Show clear ability to discuss and understand technical concepts, helping to factor technical trade-offs into your scenario modelling. 
- Have complete control and understanding of all the daily business metrics to ensure we deliver a 7 star experience to our customers.
- Build a strong relationship with stakeholders from across the company, collecting insight and clearly communicate back to them. 
- Research and present multiple strategies for the executive team to evaluate key decisions.

## Required skills and experience:

- Extensive experience as a Product Manager or Product Leader (8+ years).
- Currently director or leading within product function.
- Strong interpersonal skills and stakeholder management.
- Previously held end to end responsibility of driving product roadmaps and strategy across cross functional product engineering teams.
- Bonus points for travel experience
- Experience directly managing product managers.
- Technical background or a deep appreciation of engineering best practice.
- Pragmatism and obsession for simplicity, efficiency, and performance.

## What do we offer?

- Competitive compensation including equity in the company.
- 24 vacation days per year and flexible working hours.
- Health perks: Choose between a private health scheme or a gym allowance.
- "Flexible compensation plan" to help you diversify and increase the net salary.
- Free Spanish classes.
- Yoga and meditation.
- Possibility to choose your hardware and tools.
- Free coffee and beverages, fresh fruit and other breakfast stuff.

The Director of Product position requires full-time, in-house work in Barcelona, Spain. We can help with relocation from anywhere in the world. English is the official language at the office. No prior knowledge of Spanish is required.

- A flawless grasp of User Experience and Visual Design
- Developing partnerships with Product Managers, Engineering Leads and the Leadership team to help elevate the voice of Design within TravelPerk

- Working with our in-house researcher to co-ordinate and run usability tests, discovery sessions, contextual analyses plus any other relevant research required to better understand the problems that our customers are faced with, identifying ways to uncover opportunities.

- Influencing the direction of our Product Design System to better serve the team.
- Continuously optimizing the design process across the Product Design team.
- Testing and optimizing low–high fidelity prototypes with key stakeholders and customers to iteratively validate that we are solving the right problems.
- Driving a mobile-first mindset across the company
- Mentoring and supporting fellow designers, bringing your unique skill-set and continually raising the bar of the team and our products.

- Working in English to a professional level, both writing and speaking

- Experience working with Sketch or Figma
- Solid communication skills (verbal and written). You are comfortable presenting ideas to multiple stakeholders and articulately defending design decisions.

- Advocating for and rolling out Design Systems
- Regular interaction with customers and prospects to understand the problem space
- A positive and proactive team player who can help to elevate us

- Defining how animation should be used and implementing a process
- Contributing to and maintaining high standards of our frontend components
- Copywriting and localization
- Improving design processes and operations
- Drive influence across the company through invaluable insights and research
- Using data to help drive more efficient decision processes (e.g. A/B testing)
- Coordinating networking events to help drive employee brand and recruitment
- Writing publicly as a way of attracting talent and positioning TravelPerk as a thought leader
- Collaborating across departments, communicating the value of design
- A Travel Industry thought leader, working ahead of the curve

- 24 vacation days per year and flexible working hours.
- Health perks: Choose between a private health scheme or a gym allowance.
- "Flexible compensation plan" to help you diversify and increase the net salary.
